University of Florida
Gainesville, Florida
Dear Raes
My apologies for the delay in replying to your letter of September 2$.
At this busy period of getting the station going and trying to get set
for the MAKE Fall Convention, I am, rather behind schedule on correspondence.
In direct reply to your question, without question the University of
Florida should hold membership in the National Association of Educational
Broadcasters. This is the one organization representing non-commercial
educational radio and TV stations and production centers. Of the approximate
one hundred and fifteen educational radio and TV stations in the country,
one hundred and five are ACTIVE members of NAEB. Of about one hundred
institutions producing radio or television programs but not operating their
own station, eighty five are ASSOCIATE members of ABB. We have about
seventy five individual or A.,s6ci/ 11' members who are individuals teaching
radio or television or just interested in educational broadcasting. NAEB
represents and promotes the interest of all of these three levels. At the
present time only active members hold a vote but a constitutional amendment
is up for approval at the Fall Convention which proposes to give the vote
to associate members also. Frankly, I do not have the scale of membership
dues at tnis moment but I am asking Harry okornia, our Executive Director,
to forward these to you immediately.
I definitely feel that you should be represented at the MAEB Convention
in New York because it will be an introduction for you to the organisation
and you will learn a great deal from the Convention. The program looks
very excellent indeed. As to the type of membership you should hold in
NAEB, you are eligible for active membership if you are operating your FM
station as a non-commercial educational enterprise. If you establish
only production studios in TV and do not operate a station as above, you
will be eligible for associate membership. If neither of the above
possibilities is true, you should certainly take an individual membership.
Active and associate memberships are institutional. Affiliates are individual
memberships.
